thread.title: Transport strike in 10 districts in Khulna Division
thread.title_full: Transport strike in 10 districts in Khulna Division

title: Transport strike in 10 districts in Khulna Division

organizations.name: transport workers federation khulna regional committee
bangladesh road transport workers federation regional committee

text:
Transport strike in 10 districts in Khulna Division Jessore Correspondent bdnews24.com Previous Next An indefinite strike has been called by the Transport Workers Federation in 10 districts of the Khulna Division to protest the life sentence given to a bus driver over the road accident that led to the deaths of filmmaker Tareque Masud and cinematographer Mishuk Munier. 
The strike began on all routes in the division at 6am on Sunday. No passenger or cargo vehicles will move, said Transport Workers Federation Khulna Regional Committee President Azizul Alam Mintu. Inter-district travellers have also faced difficulties because of the strike. Many have left the terminal after being unable to find transport. The strike was announced on Saturday after an emergency meeting at the regional committee offices in Jessore. Leaders and activists from 34 transport workers' bodies attended the meeting. They claim that Chuadanga Deluxe driver Jamir Hossain had been ‘sentenced unfairly’. On Aug 13, 2011, a bus crash on the Dhaka-Aricha Highway in Manikganj killed five, including filmmaker Tareque Masud and the then CEO of ATN News Mishuk Munier. 
On Feb, 22 Manikganj Additional District and Sessions Judge Al-Mahmud Faizul Kabir sentenced bus driver Jamir Hossain to live in prison. The workers ‘had to strike’, said Bangladesh Road Transport Workers Federation Regional Committee General Secretary Abdur Rahim Boks Dudu. “Workers refuse to drive with a life sentence hanging over their heads.”
